title: 111_hr1089
content: The "Veterans Employment Rights Realignment Act of 2009" may be cited as the short title. It enforces veterans' employment or reemployment rights through the Office of Special Counsel for federal executive agencies. The "Veterans Employment Rights Realignment Act of 2009" enforces veterans' employment rights through the Office of Special Counsel. It allows individuals to file complaints with the Secretary or the Special Counsel if they believe their employment rights are being violated by non-federal executive agency employers. The "Veterans Employment Rights Realignment Act of 2009" allows individuals to file complaints with the Special Counsel if they believe their employment rights with a Federal executive agency employer are being violated. The Secretary will investigate each complaint submitted. The Secretary investigates complaints of employment rights violations. If the complaint is not resolved, the complainant can proceed under enforcement of rights provisions. Special Counsel investigates complaints under subsection (a)(2). The Special Counsel investigates complaints to ensure compliance with employment rights provisions. If resolution is not achieved, the complainant can proceed under enforcement of rights provisions. Technical amendments are made to ensure clarity in the process. The Special Counsel investigates complaints for employment rights compliance. Amendments are made to sections 4323 and 4324 for clarity in the process. Amendments are made to subsection (b) of section 4322 for clarity in the process. Changes include replacing "Secretary" with "Special Counsel" and updating section references. Additionally, adjustments are made to sections 4325(c) and 4326. Amendments are made to section 4326, inserting references to the Special Counsel and updating language. The Veterans Benefits Improvement Act of 2004 is amended by removing section 204. These changes apply to complaints filed after the enactment of this Act. Passed the House of Representatives on May 19, 2009. Attest: LORRAINE C. MILLER, Clerk.
